title: Validate confidence screen is only shown when all of the required criteria are met.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN app is not opened via deep link
App is not being force upgraded
Confidence screen has not been shown for 12 hours 
User has seen confidence screen less than 3 times 
User has tickets with unverified primary email (dictated by badgeWallet: true from box office call)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in and app is foregrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show confidence screen above any current fragment

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged out and the onboarding process is completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show confidence screen above any current fragment

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in and app is foregrounded and there is a whats new message going to be shown
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the whats new message should be shown and the confidence screen should NOT be shown. Backgrounding then foregrounding the app should show the screen.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged out and the OnBoarding process is completed and there is a "Whats New Message"going to be shown
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the "Whats New Message" should be shown and the confidence screen should NOT be shown. Backgrounding then foregrounding the app should show the screen.

title: App opened via deep link skips showing confidence screen message
custom_preconds: GIVEN all criteria pass for opening confidence screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN app is opened via deep link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown and app should go to deep link content

title: Confidence screen has already been shown within the configurable timeout
custom_preconds: GIVEN all criteria pass for opening confidence screen except the user has already seen the confidence screen within the configurable timeout (currently 12 hours)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in and app is foregrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged out and finishes onboarding
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown

title: Confidence screen has already been shown the configurable max number of times
custom_preconds: GIVEN all criteria pass for opening confidence screen except user has seen the confidence screen more than the max (currently 3) number of times

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged in and app is foregrounded
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is logged out and onboarding is finished
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown

title: User already has verified tickets or has no tickets
custom_preconds: GIVEN all criteria pass for opening confidence screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user already  verified their ticket account
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has no tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the confidence screen should NOT be shown

title: Selecting the close button
custom_preconds: GIVEN confidence screen has been shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN close button is selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should be dismissed and the screen that was previously shown should be shown again

title: Selecting verify email button
custom_preconds: GIVEN confidence screen has been shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user select Send Verification Email button is selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the confidence screen should confirm the email should be sent, the button should change to a close button, and a user should recieve the link account email

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN "close"button is selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the confidence screen should be dismissed and the previous screen should be shown.

title: Confidence Screen - App Resumes from background
custom_preconds: GIVEN As a user who should be shown the confidence screen, I want to be reminded that I need to verify my email if the app is in the background and then foregrounded (and I haven't seen the message in 12 hours or more than 3 times)
custom_steps:
WHEN Background app when already logged into a user who will trigger the confidence screen
WHEN  Wait until the screen should be shown again (mapping the config in charles can reduce the time from 12 hours to 0 minutes)
WHEN  Foreground app displays
custom_expected: THEN  the app is foregrounded, THEN the confidence screen is shown.

title: Confidence Screen - Feature Flag Toggle On and Off
custom_preconds: GIVEN Feature flag toggle in Confidence screen
custom_steps:
WHEN fire base console open AppConfig

change enable_confidence_screen = true
custom_expected: THEN Confidence screen should shown if other rules are met

title: Confidence Screen - UI is configurable via Firebase config
Validate all data is reset when user logs out
custom_preconds: GIVEN data reset when user logged out from the MLB account

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN LogIn  with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Successfully logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN  user logs out from the Confidence screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN  the data is all reset

title: Confidence Screen if forced upgrade messaging is shown, confidence screen should not display
custom_preconds: GIVEN all criteria pass for opening confidence screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN there is a force upgrade message
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should NOT be shown

title: What's  new messaging
custom_preconds: GIVEN all criteria pass for opening confidence screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN there is also a what’s new message
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN confidence screen should be shown first and what’s new message shown after it is dismissed

title: Show message
custom_preconds:
WHEN  Ballpark user that is opening the current version of the app for the first time, I want to see a message about what has changed since the last time I opened the app

UX Notes:

All headings can and should wrap if needed
Height of the modal depends on the content. If there is only one paragraph, decrease height of the modal. If there is only a button and no text link, decrease height of the modal.
Maintain the spacing between heading, body text, buttons and the text link.
Content should not scroll, provided text will be audited to make sure it fits in the given space. If scrolling does occur, no headings should be "sticky"
custom_expected:
Heading 1 - What’s New
Heading 2 - My History
Body - Relive your baseball memories with all the photos, notes and stats from all of your ballpark visits.

Big Button Copy - Go to My History (links to My History tab)
Text Link Copy - Got It!

Note: On Android QA the message interval (time between when last seen and when to repeat) will be set by seconds rather than hours for simplified testing

title: Display New Message
custom_preconds: WHEN  Ballpark user that is opening an older version of the app, I want to see a message that my version is no longer the latest
custom_expected:
Sample Required Upgrade:
Heading 1 - What’s New
Heading 2 - New Version Available
Body - There is a new version of Ballpark available. Please go to the App Store to update to the latest features and improvements.

Big Button Copy - Upgrade

Sample Suggested Upgrade:
Heading 1 - What’s New
Heading 2 - New Version Available
Body - There is a new version of Ballpark available. Please go to the App Store to update to the latest features and improvements.

Big Button Copy - Upgrade
Text Link Copy - Not Now

title: Show Buttons
custom_preconds: GIVEN As a Ballpark user that is viewing the announcement message, I want to be able to dismiss it so I can proceed into Ballpark

title: Upgrade Notice
custom_preconds: GIVEN As a Ballpark user that is opening an older version of the app, I want to have a link to upgrade on the App Store/Google Play so I can update and use the latest features

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Login to Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Successfully Logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: Go on settings, click on About, check the version off the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Ballpark app version is shown in About section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a ballpark user open the older version of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN app should shown UPGRADE link to upgrade App Store/Google Play so I can update and use the latest features

title: Force Upgrade
custom_preconds: GIVEN As a Ballpark product owner, I want to be sure that users cannot dismiss the message and must click upgrade link so I can force users to update to the most stable version of Ballpark
